Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: We need to produce grouping of events into cases. Identify distinct patient journeys: likely three patients: age 45 M (ER), age 62 F (ER), age 28 M (Surgery). Need to assign each event to case.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We must consider logical order: registration then triage then consultation etc.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - NE
Text: For 45 M: events 1 (register), 4 (triage), 15 (discharge), also X-ray (7) and doctor consultation (23) and maybe other events. Actually doctor consultation for 45 M is at 13: timestamp 08:23:10 activity Doctor consultation, resource Dr. Lee, department ER, patient_age 45, diagnosis hairline fracture. So that belongs to same case. Also X-ray at 08:15:42 is for patient 45 M. So case includes events 1,4,7,13,15.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - NE
Text: For 62 F: events 2 (register), 5 (triage), 8 (lab test requested), 10 (lab test completed), 12 (doctor consultation), 14 (prescription), 17 (discharge). Also maybe other events? Yes.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For 28 M: events 3 (register), 6 (doctor consultation scheduled knee surgery), 9 (surgery preparation), 13 (surgery performed), 16 (recovery room), 18 (discharge). Also maybe initial triage? No triage not present for surgery case; they go directly to doctor consultation.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Case 3 (Patient 28 M, Surgery): events [3,6,9,13?, wait 13 is surgery performed, but also 6 doctor consultation, 9 prep, 13 surgery performed, 16 recovery, 18 discharge]. Actually event 13 is surgery performed, belongs to case 3. So case 3 events: [3,6,9,13,16,18].

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Check event numbers: 13 appears also in case 1? No 13 is surgery performed, not doctor consultation. So fine.
